verbose_text: Moreover, our patient also tested positive for anti-cardiolipin IgM and Beta 2 GPI IgA antibodies, which is concerning for anti-phospholipid antibody syndrome; which has also been described in two other diabetic patients with stroke one of which also had significant coagulopathy similar to our patient who developed sudden increase in D-dimer (> 20.0 ng per milliliter) and elevated PT, PTT and low fibrinogen levels (158 mg per deciliter), interestingly with a normal platelet count on day 6 of admission.
